titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: The Convocation began with a choral celebration of the Holy Communion in the Minster at 10 a.m. All the Bishops (except the Bishop of Chester) communicated, though none were fasting. This might, perhaps, go to show that Anglo–Catholic convictions are not strong on the Bench! We voted the Address to the King after making some small amendments. Then we talked about patronage on the motion of the Bishop of Manchester. There being nothing more on the agenda, I returned to Auckland, being met by Clayton and William at Darlington, and motored to the Castle through a snow–covered country.
